November 27, 2024

La Habra, California

Where is La Habra, California

La Habra, California is a city in the United States of America. La Habra is located in the Orange County California region. It sits at the northern edge right next to the Los Angles County Area.

How Did La Habra Get it's Name?

La Habra got it's name from an early land grant given by the Mexican Government to Mariano Reyes Roldan a farmer who ended up naming his land "Rancho La Habra". The area was more famously named by Don Gaspar de Portol√°, a Spanish Explorer, who encountered the region when he was making his way up from San Diego into Monterey along the California coast.

What Does La Habra Mean

The name La Habra means "the opening" or "the pass through the hills" in Spanish referring to it's position between Chino Hills & Puente Hills.

La Habra As A City

La Habra began as a city of 3,000 people in 1925 and has grown to a population of about ~62,000 in 2024.

La Habra Economy

In it's early years La Habra greatly benefited from being in one of the largest citrus and avocados producing regions in the world. Today the city has diversified it's economy with Walmart & CVS being the largest employers in the city.

Richard Nixon A La Habra Local

La Habra was also famously stomping grounds for Americas 37th President, Richard Milhous Nixon. In 1938 Richard Nixon opened his first law office in the center of La Habra. While the building was tore down in 1992 due to safety concerns, a plaque remains where the building stood honoring the legacy.
